nutrients.name: Vitamin B12
nutrients.description: Water-soluble vitamin essential for nerve function, DNA production, and red blood cell formation

nutrients.name: Vitamin D
nutrients.description: Fat-soluble vitamin that promotes calcium absorption and bone health, and supports immune, nerve, and muscle function
nutrients.contraindications: Hypercalcemia, kidney disease at high doses

nutrients.name: Vitamin C
nutrients.description: Water-soluble vitamin and antioxidant that supports immune function and collagen synthesis
nutrients.contraindications: History of kidney stones, hemochromatosis at high doses

nutrients.name: Iron
nutrients.description: Essential mineral critical for oxygen transport, energy production, and immune function

nutrients.name: Magnesium
nutrients.description: Essential mineral involved in over 300 enzymatic reactions, including energy production, protein synthesis, and muscle and nerve function

nutrients.name: Zinc
nutrients.description: Essential trace mineral vital for immune function, protein synthesis, wound healing, DNA synthesis, and cell division

nutrients.name: Omega-3 Fatty Acids
nutrients.description: Essential polyunsaturated fatty acids that play crucial roles in brain function, inflammation, and heart health

nutrients.name: Creatine
nutrients.description: Naturally occurring compound that helps supply energy to cells, particularly muscle cells

dosage.therapeutic: 20g daily for 5-7 days (loading phase), followed by 3-5g daily

nutrients.contraindications: Kidney disease, potential concerns during pregnancy

nutrients.name: Ashwagandha
nutrients.description: Adaptogenic herb used in Ayurvedic medicine to help the body manage stress and promote well-being

nutrients.name: Coenzyme Q10
nutrients.description: Naturally occurring antioxidant involved in energy production within cells; levels decline with age and statin use

nutrients.name: N-Acetyl Cysteine
nutrients.description: Modified form of the amino acid cysteine that acts as a precursor to glutathione, one of the body's most powerful antioxidants

nutrients.name: Curcumin
nutrients.description: Active compound in turmeric with potent anti-inflammatory and antioxidant properties
nutrients.contraindications: Gallbladder disease, bleeding disorders, prior to surgery

nutrients.name: Probiotics
nutrients.description: Live beneficial bacteria and yeasts that support gut health and overall wellness

nutrients.name: Vitamin A
nutrients.description: Fat-soluble vitamin essential for vision, immune function, cell growth, and reproductive health

dosage.therapeutic: Up to 3000mcg RAE daily (medical supervision required)

nutrients.name: Vitamin E
nutrients.description: Fat-soluble antioxidant that protects cells from oxidative damage and supports immune function

nutrients.name: Lysine
nutrients.description: Essential amino acid important for protein synthesis, calcium absorption, and collagen formation
nutrients.contraindications: High doses in liver or kidney disease

nutrients.name: Turmeric
nutrients.description: Anti-inflammatory herb containing curcuminoids, primarily curcumin, with broad therapeutic potential
nutrients.contraindications: Gallbladder problems, bleeding disorders, scheduled surgery

nutrients.name: Beets
nutrients.description: Root vegetable rich in nitrates, betalains, and other bioactive compounds that support cardiovascular health and athletic performance

nutrients.name: Lemon
nutrients.description: Citrus fruit rich in vitamin C, citric acid, flavonoids, and other bioactive compounds with alkalizing and cleansing properties
nutrients.contraindications: Heartburn, GERD, citrus allergies, dental sensitivity

nutrients.name: Plant-based BCAAs
nutrients.description: Plant-derived branched-chain amino acids (leucine, isoleucine, and valine) that support muscle protein synthesis and recovery
nutrients.contraindications: ALS (some evidence), pregnancy, specific metabolic disorders

nutrients.name: L-Leucine
nutrients.description: Essential branched-chain amino acid that is the primary activator of mTOR pathway for muscle protein synthesis
nutrients.contraindications: ALS (some evidence), pregnancy, certain metabolic disorders

nutrients.name: L-Isoleucine
nutrients.description: Essential branched-chain amino acid important for glucose uptake into cells and hemoglobin production
nutrients.contraindications: ALS (some evidence), pregnancy, certain metabolic disorders

nutrients.name: L-Valine
nutrients.description: Essential branched-chain amino acid that supports muscle metabolism, tissue repair, and nitrogen balance
nutrients.contraindications: ALS (some evidence), pregnancy, certain metabolic disorders

nutrients.name: Propionyl L-Carnitine
nutrients.description: Specialized form of L-carnitine that supports cardiovascular health, energy production, and circulation

nutrients.name: Beetroot
nutrients.description: Concentrated form of beets rich in nitrates that convert to nitric oxide in the body, supporting cardiovascular function and exercise performance

nutrients.name: Whey
nutrients.description: Complete protein derived from milk that is quickly absorbed and rich in essential amino acids, particularly leucine

nutrients.name: Raw Cacao
nutrients.description: Minimally processed cocoa rich in flavanols, theobromine, and other bioactive compounds that support cardiovascular and cognitive health
nutrients.contraindications: Caffeine sensitivity, migraine triggers, reflux, certain heart arrhythmias

nutrients.name: Sunflower Lecithin
nutrients.description: Plant-derived source of phospholipids, particularly phosphatidylcholine, that supports cellular membranes, brain health, and liver function

nutrients.name: Niacin
nutrients.description: Vitamin B3, essential for energy production, DNA repair, and cholesterol metabolism

dosage.therapeutic: 100-3000mg daily (medical supervision recommended for high doses)

nutrients.contraindications: Liver disease, peptic ulcers, severe hypotension

nutrients.name: Bovine Liver
nutrients.description: Nutrient-dense organ meat supplement containing highly bioavailable vitamin A, B vitamins, iron, copper, and other nutrients

nutrients.name: Inositol
nutrients.description: Naturally occurring carbohydrate that functions as a cellular mediator for insulin and neurotransmitter activity

nutrients.name: L-Tyrosine
nutrients.description: Non-essential amino acid that serves as a precursor to neurotransmitters dopamine, norepinephrine, and epinephrine
nutrients.contraindications: Graves' disease, hyperthyroidism, melanoma, use of MAO inhibitors

nutrients.name: L-Glutamine
nutrients.description: Conditionally essential amino acid important for intestinal health, immune function, and recovery from stress and injury
nutrients.contraindications: Liver disease, Reye syndrome, disorders of protein metabolism

nutrients.name: L-Theanine
nutrients.description: Unique amino acid found primarily in tea that promotes relaxation without sedation and supports cognitive function

nutrients.name: Vitamin B1 (Thiamine)
nutrients.description: Water-soluble vitamin essential for energy metabolism and nerve function

nutrients.name: Vitamin B2 (Riboflavin)
nutrients.description: Water-soluble vitamin crucial for energy production, cellular function, and maintaining proper metabolism

nutrients.name: Vitamin B6 (Pyridoxine)
nutrients.description: Water-soluble vitamin involved in over 100 enzyme reactions, particularly protein metabolism and neurotransmitter synthesis
nutrients.contraindications: Nerve damage with long-term high dosages (>200mg daily)

nutrients.name: Folate (Vitamin B9)
nutrients.description: Water-soluble B vitamin essential for DNA synthesis, cell division, and homocysteine metabolism

nutrients.name: Biotin (Vitamin B7)
nutrients.description: Water-soluble B vitamin necessary for metabolism of fatty acids, amino acids, and glucose
interactions: Can interfere with certain lab tests including thyroid and cardiac markers

nutrients.name: Pantothenic Acid (Vitamin B5)
nutrients.description: Water-soluble vitamin essential for the synthesis of coenzyme A, fatty acid metabolism, and energy production

nutrients.name: Calcium
nutrients.description: Essential mineral crucial for bone health, muscle contraction, nerve signaling, and cardiovascular function
nutrients.contraindications: Hypercalcemia, kidney stones, certain heart conditions

nutrients.name: Chromium
nutrients.description: Trace mineral that enhances insulin action and influences carbohydrate, protein, and lipid metabolism
nutrients.contraindications: Kidney or liver disease, in high doses

nutrients.name: Copper
nutrients.description: Essential trace mineral involved in iron metabolism, connective tissue formation, energy production, and antioxidant defense

nutrients.name: Potassium
nutrients.description: Essential electrolyte that regulates fluid balance, muscle contractions, and nerve signals

dosage.therapeutic: Supplementation typically limited to 99mg per dose due to regulations

nutrients.name: Selenium
nutrients.description: Essential trace mineral that functions as part of antioxidant enzymes and supports thyroid hormone metabolism
nutrients.contraindications: Selenium sensitivity, high doses can be toxic

nutrients.name: MSM (Methylsulfonylmethane)
nutrients.description: Naturally occurring sulfur compound that supports joint health, inflammation reduction, and antioxidant activity
nutrients.contraindications: Blood-thinning conditions, sulfa allergies (different but caution advised)

nutrients.name: Beta-Carotene
nutrients.description: Plant pigment that the body can convert to vitamin A, with antioxidant properties that support immune and eye health
nutrients.contraindications: Smoking (increased lung cancer risk), heavy alcohol use

nutrients.name: DHEA
nutrients.description: Naturally occurring hormone precursor that can be converted into estrogen and testosterone, supporting hormone balance and aging

nutrients.name: Alpha Lipoic Acid
nutrients.description: Unique antioxidant that is both water and fat-soluble, involved in energy production and has potential to regenerate other antioxidants
nutrients.contraindications: Thyroid conditions (monitor closely), diabetes (monitor blood sugar)

nutrients.name: Astaxanthin
nutrients.description: Powerful carotenoid antioxidant with anti-inflammatory properties, predominantly found in marine organisms

nutrients.name: Lutein & Zeaxanthin
nutrients.description: Carotenoid antioxidants that concentrate in the eye's macula and help filter harmful blue light and support visual health

nutrients.name: Melatonin
nutrients.description: Natural hormone that regulates sleep-wake cycles and has antioxidant properties
nutrients.contraindications: Autoimmune conditions, depression, pregnancy, dementia, seizure disorders

nutrients.name: Resveratrol
nutrients.description: Plant compound with antioxidant properties found in grapes, berries, and peanuts that may support cardiovascular health and longevity

nutrients.name: Bioflavonoids
nutrients.description: Plant compounds with antioxidant properties that support circulation, immune function, and cellular health

nutrients.name: Dandelion Root Extract
nutrients.description: Traditional herb used for liver support, detoxification, and as a natural diuretic with antioxidant properties
nutrients.contraindications: Bile duct obstruction, gallbladder disease, intestinal blockage, allergies to plants in the Asteraceae family

nutrients.name: Peppermint Leaf Extract
nutrients.description: Aromatic herb with menthol and other compounds that provide digestive relief, respiratory benefits, and antimicrobial properties
nutrients.contraindications: GERD, hiatal hernia, gallstones, bile duct obstruction

nutrients.name: Bromelain
nutrients.description: Proteolytic enzyme derived from pineapple stems with anti-inflammatory, digestive, and circulation-supporting properties
nutrients.contraindications: Bleeding disorders, upcoming surgery, pineapple allergy

nutrients.name: Slippery Elm Inner Bark Extract
nutrients.description: Demulcent herb that forms a protective gel when mixed with water, soothing irritated tissues throughout the digestive tract
nutrients.contraindications: May delay absorption of other medications; take 2 hours apart

nutrients.name: Ginger Extract
nutrients.description: Spicy rhizome with potent anti-inflammatory, digestive-supporting, and circulation-enhancing compounds

nutrients.name: Amla (Indian Gooseberry)
nutrients.description: Vitamin C-rich adaptogenic fruit used in Ayurvedic medicine to promote longevity, strengthen immunity, and support overall health
nutrients.contraindications: Bleeding disorders, diabetes (monitor blood sugar), liver disease, gall bladder problems

nutrients.name: Reishi Mushroom
nutrients.description: Ancient medicinal mushroom with immunomodulating, stress-reducing, and longevity-promoting properties
nutrients.contraindications: Autoimmune conditions (consult healthcare provider), bleeding disorders, before/after surgery

nutrients.name: Cordyceps
nutrients.description: Energizing fungus that enhances oxygen utilization, supports physical performance, and modulates immune function
nutrients.contraindications: Autoimmune conditions (consult healthcare provider), mold allergies, pregnancy

nutrients.name: Rhodiola Rosea
nutrients.description: Arctic root herb that helps the body adapt to physical, mental, and environmental stress while supporting energy and cognitive function

nutrients.name: Chamomile Flower Extract
nutrients.description: Gentle floral herb with calming, anti-inflammatory, and digestive-soothing properties, rich in apigenin and other beneficial compounds
nutrients.contraindications: Allergy to plants in the Asteraceae family, pregnancy (in high doses)

nutrients.name: Valerian Root Extract
nutrients.description: Traditional sleep and anxiety herb that modulates GABA receptors for natural relaxation and improved sleep quality
nutrients.contraindications: Pregnancy, liver disease, operation of machinery, alcohol consumption

nutrients.name: Holy Basil (Tulsi)
nutrients.description: Sacred Ayurvedic herb with adaptogenic, anti-stress, and immunomodulatory properties that balances physiological processes
nutrients.contraindications: Anticoagulant therapy, pregnancy, diabetes (monitor blood sugar)

nutrients.name: Hops Extract
nutrients.description: Flowering plant used in brewing that contains sedative compounds supporting relaxation, sleep, and female hormonal balance

nutrients.name: Gamma-Aminobutyric Acid
nutrients.description: Inhibitory neurotransmitter that reduces neuronal excitability throughout the nervous system, promoting calm and relaxation
nutrients.contraindications: Pregnancy, bipolar disorder, kidney disease, liver disease

nutrients.name: Collagen
nutrients.description: Structural protein abundant in connective tissues that supports skin elasticity, joint health, and gut integrity
nutrients.contraindications: Generally well tolerated, shellfish allergy (marine sources)

nutrients.name: Xylooligosaccharide
nutrients.description: Specialized prebiotic fiber that selectively nourishes beneficial Bifidobacteria in the gut microbiome
nutrients.contraindications: SIBO (Small Intestinal Bacterial Overgrowth), certain digestive disorders

nutrients.name: Nicotinamide Mononucleotide
nutrients.description: Direct precursor to NAD+, a critical coenzyme involved in energy metabolism, DNA repair, and cellular signaling

nutrients.name: Spore-based Probiotics
nutrients.description: Highly resilient bacterial spores that survive stomach acid and colonize the intestines for targeted microbiome support

nutrients.name: Berberine
nutrients.description: Plant alkaloid with powerful effects on glucose metabolism, lipid levels, and gut health
nutrients.contraindications: Pregnancy, newborns (risk of kernicterus), liver disease

nutrients.name: Pyrroloquinoline Quinone
nutrients.description: Redox cofactor that supports mitochondrial function, biogenesis, and neuroprotection

nutrients.name: Alpha-Ketoglutarate
nutrients.description: Key Krebs cycle intermediate that supports energy production, collagen synthesis, and cellular protection
nutrients.contraindications: Kidney disease, high dose calcium-sensitive conditions

nutrients.name: Carnosine
nutrients.description: Naturally occurring dipeptide concentrated in muscle and brain tissue with anti-glycation and antioxidant properties

nutrients.name: Tart Cherry Extract
nutrients.description: Rich source of anthocyanins and anti-inflammatory compounds that support recovery, sleep, and joint health

nutrients.name: Apigenin
nutrients.description: Natural flavonoid found in chamomile, parsley, and celery that modulates inflammation, supports sleep, and offers neuroprotection

nutrients.name: Cyanidins (from Black Elderberry)
nutrients.description: Powerful anthocyanin pigments with immune-supporting, antiviral, and antioxidant properties

nutrients.name: L-Carnitine
nutrients.description: Amino acid derivative that transports fatty acids into mitochondria for energy production and supports heart health

nutrients.name: 5-HTP
nutrients.description: Precursor to serotonin that supports mood, sleep quality, and appetite regulation
nutrients.contraindications: Depression (if taking medications), pregnancy, Parkinson's disease, surgery (within 2 weeks)

nutrients.name: Lion's Mane Mushroom
nutrients.description: Unique mushroom containing compounds that stimulate nerve growth factor (NGF) and support cognitive function, neuronal health, and digestion

nutrients.name: Chaga Mushroom
nutrients.description: Antioxidant-rich fungus that grows on birch trees with immune-modulating, anti-inflammatory, and DNA-protective properties
nutrients.contraindications: Autoimmune conditions (monitor), blood disorders, surgery (discontinue 2 weeks before)

nutrients.name: Turkey Tail Mushroom
nutrients.description: One of the most researched medicinal mushrooms, rich in polysaccharides (PSK, PSP) that support immune function and gut health
interactions: Chemotherapy drugs (often used together under medical supervision)

nutrients.name: Shiitake Mushroom
nutrients.description: Culinary and medicinal mushroom containing lentinan, eritadenine, and other compounds that support cardiovascular health and immune function

nutrients.name: Maitake Mushroom
nutrients.description: Adaptogenic mushroom containing D-fraction and beta-glucans that support immune function, blood sugar regulation, and metabolic health

nutrients.name: Bacopa Monnieri
nutrients.description: Traditional Ayurvedic herb that supports memory, learning, and cognitive function through bacosides that protect neurons and enhance neurotransmission

nutrients.name: Phosphatidylserine
nutrients.description: Essential phospholipid component of cell membranes that supports cognitive function, memory, and stress hormone regulation

nutrients.name: Citicoline (CDP-Choline)
nutrients.description: Naturally occurring compound that supports brain health by enhancing phosphatidylcholine synthesis, acetylcholine levels, and neuronal repair

nutrients.name: Huperzine A
nutrients.description: Purified compound from Chinese club moss that inhibits acetylcholinesterase, increasing acetylcholine levels and supporting memory and cognitive function
nutrients.contraindications: Seizure disorders, bradycardia, GI blockage, asthma, pregnancy

nutrients.name: Vinpocetine
nutrients.description: Semi-synthetic derivative of the periwinkle plant that enhances cerebral blood flow, glucose utilization, and neuroprotection
nutrients.contraindications: Pregnancy, breastfeeding, recent surgery, bleeding disorders

nutrients.name: Sulforaphane
nutrients.description: Sulfur-rich compound derived from cruciferous vegetables (especially broccoli sprouts) that activates Nrf2 pathway for cellular detoxification and protection

nutrients.name: Pterostilbene
nutrients.description: Methylated form of resveratrol found in blueberries with superior bioavailability and potent effects on cellular health, cognition, and longevity pathways

nutrients.name: Diindolylmethane (DIM)
nutrients.description: Metabolite of indole-3-carbinol found in cruciferous vegetables that supports healthy estrogen metabolism and hormonal balance

nutrients.name: Quercetin
nutrients.description: Potent bioflavonoid with antioxidant, anti-inflammatory, and antihistamine properties that supports immune function and cellular health
nutrients.contraindications: Kidney disorders (high doses), pregnancy, anticoagulant therapy

nutrients.name: Olive Leaf Extract
nutrients.description: Rich in oleuropein and other polyphenols with antimicrobial, antioxidant, and cardiovascular benefits
nutrients.contraindications: Low blood pressure, diabetes (monitor blood sugar)

nutrients.name: Taurine
nutrients.description: Conditionally essential amino acid that supports cardiovascular function, bile acid conjugation, osmotic regulation, and neurotransmission

nutrients.name: Glycine
nutrients.description: Non-essential amino acid that functions as an inhibitory neurotransmitter and supports collagen synthesis, detoxification, and sleep quality

nutrients.name: Beta-Alanine
nutrients.description: Non-essential amino acid that combines with histidine to form carnosine, which buffers lactic acid in muscles and improves exercise performance

nutrients.name: L-Citrulline
nutrients.description: Non-essential amino acid that enhances nitric oxide production, improving blood flow, exercise performance, and cardiovascular health
nutrients.contraindications: Taking nitrates, erectile dysfunction medications, blood pressure medications

nutrients.name: Agmatine Sulfate
nutrients.description: Decarboxylated arginine that modulates multiple neurotransmitter systems, nitric oxide levels, and pain signaling pathways

nutrients.name: Urolithin A
nutrients.description: Gut microbiome metabolite of ellagitannins (from pomegranates and berries) that stimulates mitophagy, promoting mitochondrial health and cellular rejuvenation
nutrients.contraindications: Limited data for pregnancy and nursing

nutrients.name: Sulbutiamine
nutrients.description: Synthetic derivative of thiamine (vitamin B1) that crosses the blood-brain barrier more effectively, supporting energy metabolism and cognitive function

nutrients.name: GlyNAC (Glycine + NAC)
nutrients.description: Combination of glycine and N-acetylcysteine that synergistically supports glutathione synthesis, mitochondrial function, and oxidative stress reduction

nutrients.name: Palmitoylethanolamide (PEA)
nutrients.description: Naturally occurring fatty acid amide that modulates pain and inflammation through multiple mechanisms, including PPAR-alpha activation

nutrients.name: Fucoxanthin
nutrients.description: Marine carotenoid from brown seaweed that supports metabolism, fat oxidation, and cellular health through unique biological mechanisms
forms: In combination with pomegranate seed oil

nutrients.name: Lithium Orotate
nutrients.description: Low-dose, highly bioavailable form of lithium that supports neurological health, mood stability, and cognitive function
nutrients.contraindications: Kidney disease, dehydration, sodium-restricted diets, pregnancy, nursing

nutrients.name: Boron
nutrients.description: Trace mineral essential for bone health, hormone metabolism, cognitive function, and inflammatory response

nutrients.name: Molybdenum
nutrients.description: Essential trace mineral that functions as a cofactor for enzymes involved in detoxification, cellular energy production, and sulfur metabolism
nutrients.contraindications: Gout (high doses), copper deficiency, biliary obstruction

nutrients.name: Vanadium
nutrients.description: Trace mineral that mimics insulin and supports glucose metabolism, protein metabolism, and bone health
nutrients.contraindications: Kidney disease, liver disease, pregnancy, nursing

nutrients.name: Strontium
nutrients.description: Naturally occurring mineral similar to calcium that supports bone density, formation, and strength
nutrients.contraindications: Kidney disease, pregnancy, nursing, increased risk of blood clots, heart disease

nutrients.name: Digestive Enzymes
nutrients.description: Specialized proteins that break down macronutrients for optimal digestion, nutrient absorption, and reduced digestive discomfort

nutrients.name: Aloe Vera
nutrients.description: Succulent plant extract with soothing, healing properties that support digestive health, skin integrity, and immune function
nutrients.contraindications: Pregnancy, Crohn's disease, ulcerative colitis, intestinal obstruction, hemorrhoids

nutrients.name: Artichoke Extract
nutrients.description: Leaf extract rich in cynarin and other compounds that support liver function, bile flow, digestion, and cholesterol metabolism
nutrients.contraindications: Bile duct obstruction, gallstones, allergies to plants in the Asteraceae family

nutrients.name: Triphala
nutrients.description: Traditional Ayurvedic blend of three fruits (amalaki, bibhitaki, haritaki) that gently cleanses the digestive tract while providing antioxidant support

nutrients.name: Betaine HCl
nutrients.description: Acidic compound that supports stomach acid production, protein digestion, and nutrient absorption, particularly in those with hypochlorhydria
nutrients.contraindications: Active ulcers, gastritis, esophagitis, GERD, use of NSAIDs or corticosteroids
